ygData.subject: Re: High Elf Paladins?
ygData.msgSnippet: I have found that the best way to improve your 1H blunt is to get a party together of at least 2 tanks (yourself being one) and a couple of magic users. By
ygData.messageBody:
I have found that the best way to improve your 1H blunt is to get a party
together of at least 2 tanks (yourself being one) and a couple of magic
users. By going to the mino caves (Steamfont) and drawing out trains, I have
gotten my skill up to 72. it took forever to get those first 20, but after
that it went pretty fast. it usually helps if the other tank is a higher
level than you and pretty good at taunting. be sure to always carry your
better weapon with you, though, as emergencies can arise pretty fast with a
train of 3 blue conning minos.

Eglath (one of those High Elf chicks..) *grin*

"By G'Quon, I cannot remember the last time I was in a fight like that! No
moral ambiguity. No ancient and overpowering Enemy. They were, as you say,
the Bad Guys, and we were the Good Guys....and they made a very satisfying
*thump* when they hit the ground!"
--G'Kar, A Late Delivery from Avalon

On Mon, 24 May 1999 RangerDest@... wrote:

> From: RangerDest@...
>
> Yeah. I agree with your conclusions of Strength. So far I get one
> ATK for every STR I have (once in a while it is 2 ATK per). It really all
> depends on the weapon skill, strength giving it a magnifying effect. I, as a
> dwarf, poured my points into my starting agility of 70 and now have 90 of it,
> same as my dex. The only downside of a dwarf is the horrible int of 60 and
> the even worse charisma of 55! I once got stunk by a skunk and had it down
> to 15! Heheh
>
> But the skill-maxing is really not a problem for me. I heard that
> dwarves get a higher XP penalty than high elves but I'm not sure. If true,
> that gives you plenty of time to max everything =)
>
> As for weapons, I use one handed slashing. I know that a two hander
> is better for dmg but I figure the lower delay time (26 thanks to the dwarven
> axe) and bash dmg gets me almost equal to a 2H. Only reason I don't like 2H
> is because you are trying to do a lot of dmg at once, and if you miss once
> you miss for it all. With a bunch of small attacks you may miss half the
> time but you'll still hit your opponent. Again the higher dmg for the 2H
> solves this. The only time I would use a 2H is against a monster with a fire
> shield of some sort.
>
> I have also started to train up my 1H blunt so that I'll be able to
> use the rank 2 summoned weapon. Anyone have any tips for raising this stupid
> skill? I'm too low to actually fight anything blue+. Thanks.
>
> Well, I love playing a dwarf because if I am grumpy in real life I
> can be grumpy in the game under the pretense of role-playing! And it sure is
> fun to group with those high elf women and tell them they would be very
> pretty if they had beards =)
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> ONElist: where real people with real interests get connected.
> http://www.onelist.com
> Join a new list today!
>
